intro: Rhytidostemma viride, commonly known as the green-stemmed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and lance-shaped, with a somewhat hairy surface. Rhytidostemma viride is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
